name: Hotel Acte V

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great budget accommodation. Julie gave us wonderful recommendations for nearby restaurants (avoid eating near the Eiffel Tower as you will be surrounded by non-so-friendly tourist traps), and the entire staff was very friendly and accommodating. Rooms are small, but this is typical for Paris. If you stay at this hotel, stand on the bed and reach up to touch the ceiling, and you will have an interesting suprise. The ceilings are bouncy, like a balloon, as we discovered by chance. We would definately stay in this hotel again.
reviews.title: Would return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for three nights in September. The Hotel rooms are small but they are very well maintained. Very clean rooms, bathrooms and toilets. Hotel staff are very friendly and accomodating. Great Location! Reasonably Priced!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once again, the TripAdvisor reviews did not let us down. Hotel Monge was everything we were looking for - an inexpensive hotel with decent rooms in a good location.
reviews.title: Another homerun for TripAdvisor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was nice having A/C and a mini fridge. I would have preferred having a safe in the room but that's OK. The shower was very small but manageable. I did hear some noise from adjacent rooms (water running, phones ringing, etc.), but it was never too loud to be disturbing.
reviews.title: Nice but small

reviews.text: The staff was friendly and helpful. After checking out, we were able to keep our luggage at the hotel. They even took the cheeses we bought and kept them in a fridge for us!
reviews.title: Well run and very friendly

reviews.text: Would highly recommend this hotel. Stayed for 4 nights with my 8 year old daughter. Perfect location, rooms very clean and fresh, The
reviews.title: nice hotel, great area

reviews.text: bath linen was changed every day. The bathroom however is very small so if you are bigger or taller than the average person you may have a problem. This was room 35 but maybe there are other rooms with bigger showers. Well worth asking though as it's really a lovely hotel,especially the lounge and reception. The staff were very helpful and speak good English. Lots of cafes for breakfast in the morning, our favourite was ' le petit ecolier' across the road to the right, which does a lovely omellete with croissants,juice, coffee and bread for less than 8 euros ! Rue mouffetard is beautiful and full of lovely boutiques, crepe shops and very reasonable set price menus of which the food was delicious. Try the little Chinese vendor , 12 euros for a meal for two. Also the cafe bar which sells fantastic crepes and home made hot chocolate. Stay at this hotel, we really had a FAB time !!!!
reviews.title: Quaint and Wonderful

reviews.text: Was referred by family member who travels to Paris often, and was thrilled with the hotel. The lovely lady in charge was helpful and spoke pretty good english. The continental breakfast was well worth the price, and the rooms were comfortable, though not exactly spacious. The Hotel is located close to Metro Stations, and taxis are not a problem. I was there with my 10 year old daughter for 10 days, and would definitely return to the Hotel Monge every time I am in Paris!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is easily accessed from the metro. The rooms were clean, comfortable and updated. The staff was friendly and helpful. Be sure to check out the area across the street and up the steps from the hotel. Rue Moufettard. A lovely cafe and restaurant area with no cars. We had fantastic crepes at a tiny litle cafe.
reviews.title: Met our needs and a little more

reviews.text: This hotel was more like a bed and breakfast. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was small, but nice, very clean. The shower was great and bathroom was clean as well. We overlooked Rue Monge and the street was a bit noisy at night with the window open. Hotel is in a great location, close to train stops and many bakeries. Overall, it met our needs and i would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - will come here again

reviews.text: Hotel Monge was a great hotel.Thanks again Julie for your kindness.The rooms were fantastic.This hotel and location has to be one of the best for all around Paris location.The rooms were large and very clean.Just a block from several metro stations.Staff was very kind.You made our trip to Paris very pleasent.Would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Merci

reviews.text: The first impression I got when I walked in was ‘This place is clean’ – looked clean and smelled clean. Throughout the week I would always see someone cleaning something. My room was number 66, top floor single in the back. Again, clean; the walls had a nice peach wall paper; it was plenty big enough for one person and having two people in it would not be unreasonable. A large armoire with plenty of space; 2 smaller beds pushed together to make a queen; a desk; a small TV; and a stocked mini fridge. The bathroom was small but actually had a counter at the sink where you could put your ‘stuff’. The bed was comfortable and it had two large US type pillows.
reviews.title: Great Stay At Hotel Monge
Great stay at Monge!
reviews.text: The room had a view of the Arena which was especially nice. I would come back to the hotel in the afternoons for a nap and it was great to hear the sounds of children playing. On Sunday morning there was a spirited game of football between two different fire companies. The rest of the week there would be children playing, men playing boules, people picnicking. At night it was very, very quiet.

I read before I left about the size of the elevator and the shower but they really are something best experienced. The elevator has an occupancy of 3 but you would need to be 3 VERY close friends. It worked all week though and being on the 6th floor that is what counted. The shower is about the size of the elevator with a handheld shower head. It takes a few days to master the art of getting clean without flooding the bathroom but it can be done. As someone said in a review, don’t drop the soap.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel - Location, Price, Comfort

reviews.text: The location was very good. There are all sorts of shops in the blocks around the hotel. A lot of boulangeries/patisseries, a great fromargerie across the street, cafes, and public transport in abundance. It is a 5-10 minute bus ride to Notre Dame, about 15 minutes on the metro to the Louvre. I paid 78 euros a night and felt I got a great bargain.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With only two nights to spend in Paris, my fiancé and I wanted an affordable room in the heart of the city. We booked Hotel Acte V on the recommendation of an in-the-know friend, and loved it. The location was perfect: within minutes from must-see tourist spots like Jardin des Plantes and Notre Dame, and just steps from the cafes and restaurants on Rue Mouffetard. Also around the corner from the best croissant in Paris (Maison Keyser), so def. skip the hotel breakfast! Our room was small but clean (only prob was the shower: no shower head or shower curtain, just a modern spigot at the end of a hose) with a lovely view of bustling Rue Monge (thick glass windows meant noise stayed outside). Staff was very sweet. This isn't exactly luxurious, but we found it to be excellent value for the money. The hotel was the ideal launching pad for our explorations of the city.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

likes.liked: — Location (walking distance from everything!), price, view from the room, very close to subways, staff
likes.disliked: — The shower situation (no shower head or curtain meant awkward showering and soaking wet bathroom), leaky air conditioner

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed for just one night at ACT V and loved it. We were able to easily walk to great attractions and streets in Paris. The neighborhood itself if cute. The room was small but very comfortable. We did not have the breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel. It was great value for the money.
reviews.title: Great, Comfortable Boutique Hotel

likes.liked: — The location and the hotel staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at this extremely convenient hotel in the Rue de Monge during the tenure of Julie I was interested to see what difference the owners had made.
reviews.title: Changed since Julie left!

likes.disliked: — Lack of interest from the owners/staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms appear to be unaltered but reception and breakfast area now a bordelo crimson red.
reviews.title: Great area for exploring...

reviews.text: Believe it is now family run but there was a distinct lack of visible staff apart from the occasional head of someone sitting behind the reception desk. At no time did any member of staff address us or ask if everything was OK. Breakfast overpriced at 11 Euros and totally self service with not a member of staff on hand.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a wonderful 5-night stay at the hotel in mid-October. For the price, you could not ask for a better hotel for the location. We were within walking distance of Notre Dame, Pantheon and yummy Eric Kayser as well as Sunday's street market at Place Monge. We were also one step away from several metro stops that whisked us all over the city.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the price and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff was very pleasant and accommodating. Manon, for our first night, recommended a great little Corsican restaurant called Le Cosi near the Sorbonne, which was a great start to our Parisian culinary adventures. The room itself was on the small side but was to be expected in Paris. We had a room on the 3rd floor facing the street. I would have preferred a room facing the Arenes de Lutece, but one was not available the day we checked in. The double paned windows did help reduce the street noise significantly, however I still had to wear earplugs in order to fall asleep. I travel often and am used to this, but if you are not I recommend specifying a room facing the park if possible.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly, and convenient

reviews.text: We had breakfast at the hotel once during our stay. 11 euro is really not that bad of a price considering it is a buffet and you would pay at least that much in a cafe. Like another poster, we enjoyed viennoiseries at Eric Kayser down the street. The pain au chocolat will melt in your mouth!
reviews.title: Absolutely charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a great few days in Paris, and we would stay in this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great position and clean rooms

likes.liked: — I loved the position and the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would I stay again - probably, if only for its location to central Paris, restaurants and the Metro.
reviews.title: Spot on

likes.liked: — The location close to Notre Dame, the Latin quarter and the metro.
likes.disliked: — For the price and location there's nothing to dislike.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 5 nights here in April and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Lovely hotel, staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a garden view room and it was very pleasant and very clean. Room service was good and we had tea delivered to our room each evening. Breakfast was nice and good value at 11 euros each. The only problem was that the shower over the bath was a bit hard to use and tended to flood the bathroom. I would perhaps recommend going for a room with just a shower. The location was excellent as it is near to two Metro stations, Notre Dame and the markets. Lots of coffee shops and restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the experience

likes.disliked: — Shower over bath did not work veery well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a two night break to visit the tennis at Roland Garos. This hotel is handily situated close to Cardinal Lemoine metro which is on direct line to RG. Rue Monge is quiet and less touristy than some areas and is close to Rue Mouteffard (up steps opp. hotel and follow your nose, loads of restaurants and cafes.) The very nice Jardin des Plantes is close by too.
reviews.title: Acte V OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was Paris smalland bit dreary but with a nicely refitted shower room and excellent double glazing to cut out the excessive traffic noise from the street (successfully). Unfortunately the AC in room 24 only seemed to stir the air around.
reviews.title: Perfect spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were efficient friendly and pleasant.
reviews.title: Hidden gem, loved it

reviews.text: Overall Ok but not a lot to shout about.
reviews.title: Down to Earth Paris

likes.liked: — Fair price for the acommodation provided

reviews.text: We got a triple room on the 2nd floor with pretty flowers over our balcony. We stayed here for four nights. The room was a good size for three people and quiet too when the french doors are closed considering that we were facing the main road. Housekeeping was performed daily and everything was clean. Downside were the towels, they were thin and once were given frayed ones. Julie and her staff were very helpful with regards to touristy questions and directions. This hotel is walking distance to rue mouffetard market which was marvelous with the array of food stalls, restaurants and cafes. And there is also monge fresh market every Wed. My husband said that Paris is such a food paradise and the people we met were friendly. There are 3 supermarkets nearby and laundry, just 3 minutes walk from the hotel. Bakeries are plentiful esp Kayser - try their creme brulee - Yummy! We really had a wonderful time in Paris and will be coming back.
reviews.title: clean & decent 2-star hotel

reviews.text: Due to a mix up with bookings, we arrived in Paris with no accommodation booked.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.text: We had stayed at Hotel Monge a couple of years ago, and really enjoyed our stay, so decided to see if there was a room available this time.
reviews.title: A Lovely Stereotype
Homey and Comfortable
reviews.text: We had a street facing double room on the 5th floor. Everything was just as we remembered, spotlessly clean, and so close to bakeries and the metro. An easy walk to Notre Dame etc.
This hotel is really value for money.
reviews.title: Hotel Monge lived up to Trip Advisor reviews

reviews.text: We stayed there for 5 nights, my daughter and I, and we enjoyed our stay. The room was OK in size, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was very clean, and it was quiet at night, even on street side. The hotel is very well situated: there are 2 metro stations nearby and the lively Place de la Contrescarpe and Rue Mouffetard are only 5 minutes away from the hotel. There is also a Vélib' (bike rental station) on Lacépède Street (2- minute walk) .The area is safe and I would certainly go back to this hotel on a next trip.
reviews.title: great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And the staff was friendly and very helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful generous 3 star better than it's peers, great staff, rooms, location, hard to do better for the money

reviews.text: Travelers from Montreal, Canada
reviews.title: Great value, great location

reviews.text: I am a seasoned traveller and was lucky enough to have 2 weekends in a row in Paris recently. The first time I stayed with a friend in the Hotel Acte V. It was great 3 star, modern refurb, friendly staff, great bar and lounge area, large well furnished rooms, aircdon, flat screen tv, little balconies, quiet, great location.
reviews.title: Great place, great people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 2 weekends in arow provided me with a perfect opportunity to test trip advisor. For the second trip which was a romantic weekend away with my husband sans enfant I choose the nearby 'sainte christophe' *because it was 150 points higher* than the Acte V on Trip advisor. What a *terrible* mistake. We couldn't believe it when we arrived to the drab, dated, run down place with no aircon and hot still little rooms (so hot other guests on the same floor were lying on their beds in the heat with the doors open for all to see!)
reviews.title: Top location, clean room, good mattress, safe area & reasonable too!

reviews.text: Stayed 5 nights with a colleague in March 2009. Fantastic location, very comfortable room and bed. Cannot speak too highly of this hotel, it was terrific. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. My room on 6th floor only had a shower, whereas my colleague's room on 4th floor had a bath. One side looks over the street, other side looks over Roman ruins and expansive views. Very quiet at night, central to cafes etc. I would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

reviews.text: The hotel has been recently remodeled. The exterior, the lobby and the rooms are in very good condition and were clean. The staff was courteous and informative. The room and the bathroom were microscopic. There is wireless Internet connectivity in the room.
reviews.title: A clean, pleasant room in the middle of the fifth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights at this nice little affordable hotel which we found via Tripadvisor. We got a room at the first floor which the receptionist apologised for, but as the windows were thick there was no noice from the street.
reviews.title: Nice, clean hotel, good location

reviews.text: The room was very clean and it was cleaned well every day. The bathroom and the shower were ok, however on the 3rd morning we run out of hot water for some reason. We were so happy with our stay that we didn't lose any sleep over this.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in the Latin Quarter for the price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was some noise as well as cigarette smoke coming from the room next to us at times, however the during the night it was always peaceful and smoke-free.
reviews.title: Good Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only add to the great reviews which have preceded this one .. hotel was a wonderful base for our 5 night stay. We had a room on the 1st Floor overlooking the road, there was no disturbance from traffic at all. The room was spotless and the shower hot and powerful. We didn't need anything more. The staff are also excellent. The room was cleaned daily and the reception staff were always on hand 24 hours a day (we arrived late and had to leave very early).
reviews.title: Excellent stay at the Hotel Monge

reviews.text: I would definately recommend the Hotel Monge to anyone visiting Paris
reviews.title: Loved the Monge!

reviews.text: The Hotel Monge lived up to all the great reviews! The staff are helpful and friendly, and very willing to help. They allowed me to leave my luggage the morning I checked out since my departure was not until that evening. The hotel has a tiny elevator which is just the right size for one person and your luggage.
reviews.title: Chic and Cheerful

likes.liked: — location, and it v real parisian feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was lovely and clean. I found the bathroom to be clean and perfectly adequate. The bed was comfortable and there was a television and a wardrobe to hang clothes up.
reviews.title: Comfortable, quiet Paris hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast was delightful and I looked forward to it every morning- the croissant and baguette are to die for! Of course this is the case all over Paris. The breakfast also included yogurt, cheese, and coffee/ tea/ hot chocolate.
reviews.title: OK Stay, Price too High for What you Get - Look Around for better deal!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Acte V hotel for 3 nights and we were very happy with our accommodations. Our room was clean, comfortable, and quiet (we were facing away from Rue Monge). Paul and Ana Claudia at the front desk were very helpful and friendly. The location is great - close to Notre Dame, the Metro stations and to Rue Mouffetard which has lots of restaurants and cafes. I definitely would stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent little hotel

reviews.text: Very pleased with my stay at this hotel. Stayed 3 nights and the first 2 nights I couldn't hear anything from the street or hallways. Third night was a bit noisier from the hallway and elevator. Hotel room was fine and it was nice having air conditioning that you could control and having a mini bar. Had breakfast once at the hotel....croissant, baguette, yogurt, cheese and cafe au lait. Pretty good deal, but decided to try other places.
reviews.title: LIved Up to Everyone's Reviews

likes.disliked: — Not close enough to major sites

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: Wish the hotel were closer to the action; however, it was near lots of restaurants on Rue Moutefford (sorry, forgot the spelling) and the metro was very close.

reviews.title: Good value for money
reviews.text: Recommend this hotel but might choose another one closer to, say, the Champs Elysee next time.

My best friend and I stayed in June and we had an amazing time. We are students on a budget and feared that we would have to settle when it came to our hotel, but we were wrong. The hotel was clean and the area was very safe even in the early hours of the morning. Julie and her staff were very helpful and willing to answer any of the questions that we had. The Monge is great and I will be staying there again!
reviews.title: It was great, overall

likes.disliked: — some certain staff members, but I got over it.

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in April 2007, and our experience really reflects all those on here. Very good value for money and good location - but remember it is a budget hotel! If you're looking for a comfortable, cheap stay this is a good option.
reviews.title: Perfect Place to Stay in Paris

reviews.text: Hotel Acte V (Residence Monge) on Rue Monge in Latin quarter is a wonderful option for budget accomodations. They delivered exactly what was promised. Exceptionally clean (including daily change of towels and linens) little hotel. We stayed in a room with a double bed (quite comfortable mattress) and a shower. Very courteous service with many employees proficient in English. The location is amazing, close to Rue Mouffetard, Notre-Dame, Pantheon; one to two blocks walking distance to 7 and 10 metro lines; two blocks from the wonderful Place Monge market (three times a week). There are many brasseries and cafes nearby offering breakfasts as well as several boulangeries. Depending on how one looks at it, the small shower and tiny elevator may seem as downsides. However, we found it to be a very European part of experience. We would highly recommend this hotel for young married couples, single people, open-minded middle aged adults. This may be a bit too small and uncomfortable for children and older people.
reviews.title: Great location, great service

reviews.text: I recently stayed at Hotel Acte V for four nights. I booked this hotel because I was looking for a comfortable hotel that was economical. I was pleasantly surprised to find the hotel clean, comfortable, in a great location and with friendly staff. The room was small, and my 16 year old son and I had to share the queen size bed - but this was only a small sacrifice to have such a great home away from home in Paris. It was my first trip to Paris, and when I return I'll be booking into Hotel Acte V again for sure!
reviews.title: Not a fault to be found - economical, clean, lovely staff and great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at Acte V. Great location with lots of restaurants, bakeries and grocery store near by. Hotel is very clean and our room was very nicely decorated. Free internet access if available in the lobby. They offer a breakfast which we didn't try. It looked a bit pricey for what you got. 11 Euros/person. Our room was $135 Euros/night. The hotel backs onto some interesting ruins also. It is right in between 2 metro stations less than a 5 minute walk each way.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked this hotel because the one my boyfriend's parents recommended (next door) was fully booked. Acte V was actually cheaper, and looked just as good on the web. It didn't disappoint. The hotel is in a great location, right around the corner from the Place Monge metro station, and is only a 15 minute stroll from Notre Dame. The Latin Quarter around about is full of nice little restaurants and bars. When we arrived the staff were very friendly, and mostly spoke fluent english. The hotel fronts onto a busy road, but our room was on the back of the building overlooking an amphitheatre type space and was totally quiet. The windows were double glazed so I would assume the rooms at the front would be pretty quite also.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was nice and clean, the bed was comfortable and there was also a small chair that looked like it might have folded out into a small single bed (although I didn't look too closely). The bathroom was small but functional, sink, toilet and bath. We had booked a room with a shower (bath was 10 Euros more) but we got a room with bath. It had a tap/shower head mixer which was good for rinsing, but there was nothing to put the shower head into higher up and no shower curtain, which made an actual shower a bit difficult! The room also had an excellent air conditioning unit, which was a blessing, a TV, and a small fridge under the desk. The room itself had plenty of space for 2 people.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I would definitely recommend the hotel. The location is great, the staff friendly and the rooms clean, comfy and of a good size. If I go to Paris again I'll definitely go back!
reviews.title: Great location and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Hotel Acte V after reading reviews and finding a better price on booking.com than on their site. We had a kingsize bed, and a little balcony. Couldn't see the Notre Dame from the 4th Floor, but no complaints!
reviews.title: Perfect little hotel in the heart of a great neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very friendly with English speakers, though as a former French major I used what I could. They even recommended a delightful bistro down the street for dinner. It is also really close to Metro stops so we could get home easily from other sections of town, while also being in the heart of a great neighborhood with food and shops, so you don't have to hit the tousity sites if you don't want to.
reviews.title: Good for the germaphobe

reviews.text: It also abutted ruins of an arena. Amazing.
reviews.title: Perfect stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would skip the breakfast and go up the street to a cafe to sit outside and watch Parisian life.
reviews.title: Great location. Great value. Great place.

reviews.text: The hotel is near an EMS station, so there were many sirens. If you keep the windows close, you don't hear them. But we were warm and left them open. We learned. If you are a light sleeper you may want to ask for a back room.
reviews.title: An enchanting hotel. Perfectly located; welcoming and helpful staff; excellent housekeeping

reviews.text: Since I had never been to a foreign country before, I didn't know what to expect from our hotel. I knew it came highly recommended by reading other reviews. I was pleasantly surprised and I wanted everyone else to know what a cozy, comforting atmosphere it was and especially how completely precious Julie is. She was extremely accommodating, knowledgeable, courteous and personable. I truly felt right at home in the "un-hotel-like" setting. The rooms were small, but comfortable - (the beautiful flowered sheets were a nice touch!). The entire hotel was spotless and the continental breakfast was second to none. I definitely know where I'll stay next time I'm in Paris!
reviews.title: Just like being home!

reviews.text: We just came back from our first trip to Paris and stayed at Hotel Residence Monge on the strength of the recommendations that we read on this forum. We had a room on the 4th floor facing the Arenes de Lutece (not the street) and it was very quiet and comfortable.
reviews.title: Good experience at the Hotel Residence Monge

reviews.text: Our stay was for 9 nights. Not being familiar with Paris at all, I was pleasantly surprised at how centrally located the hotel is. It is between 2 metro lines (7 and 10), a 10 minute walk from Boulevard St. Michel and Notre Dame, also close to the Pantheon. We walked back to the hotel many times rather than taking a bus (the 47 bus runs down Rue Monge) or the metro.
reviews.title: Cosy room, great location, awesome price

reviews.text: The room was adequately sized for a 2-star hotel. Very clean and neat. We had no trouble getting extra towels when we requested them. Julie's English is very good and she was always very polite and willing to answer any questions.
reviews.title: Le Quartier Latin en Automne

reviews.text: I would certainly recommend this hotel to people and would consider staying there again.
reviews.title: Loved it !!

reviews.text: My Husband and I returned yesterday from a wonderful six days in Paris where we stayed at the Hotel Residence Monge. From the first minute of arrival until the time we stepped into the taxi to leave, we could not have been more pleased with this lovely hotel and it's wonderful staff.
reviews.title: Absolutely Lovely Hotel in a Beautiful City

reviews.text: Julie is an excellent hostess, who suggested delightful restaurants, and answered questions, with a smile. (You should ask for her recommendations)
reviews.title: A place to stay
Wonderful hotel in a wonderful area!
reviews.text: Our Garden view room was immaculate, and the sight of the Roman ampitheater from the window a bonus! We requested a double, with bath, one large bed, and a garden view.

reviews.title: Great little hotel - great location - PERFECT Paris hotel!
reviews.text: Although the room was small, it was a pleasant surprise to find it bigger than expected! The bathroom ~ likewise, bigger than I expected, based on previous descriptions posted on this website. A bonus was the airconditioning, which came in handy with the unexpected heat at the end of last week!

reviews.title: Convenient and Clean
reviews.text: We found the small elevator exactly as described, small, but efficient.

description: The Hotel Acte V is located in the heart of the Latin Quarter, in a very calm area at 5min by walk from the very crowdy Saint Michel. Our 36 rooms are cosy and offer all the services you need for your comfort. Our very helpfull staff will welcome you and advise you for your visits and outing during your stay.
